intro: Peltoboykinia watanabei, commonly known as the Japanese thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a distinctive, spiny fruit that contains several seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
